name: Estazolam (ProSom)
summary: A benzodiazepine hypnotic used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.
description: Estazolam is a benzodiazepine with hypnotic, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant properties. It is primarily prescribed for the short-term management of insomnia characterized by difficulty falling asleep, frequent nocturnal awakenings, and early morning awakenings. Like other benzodiazepines, estazolam acts as a positive allosteric modulator of the GABA-A receptor, enhancing inhibitory neurotransmission.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to estazolam or other benzodiazepines

sections.text: Binds to the benzodiazepine site of the GABA-A receptor complex, enhancing the effects of GABA and increasing chloride influx, which hyperpolarizes the neuron and reduces excitability.

sections.geriatric: Start at 1 mg; increase only if necessary
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; consider lower doses
sections.renal_impairment: No adjustment needed, but use caution

sections.text: Onset within 30–60 minutes; duration of action is 6–8 hours.

other: May cause complex sleep behaviors (e.g., sleep-driving)
Risk of dependence and withdrawal symptoms after prolonged use
Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants

items: Signs of tolerance, dependence, and misuse
Respiratory status in patients with pulmonary disease

sections.lactation: Not recommended; may cause sedation in infant
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; use lowest effective dose

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over weeks to prevent withdrawal symptoms such as insomnia rebound, anxiety, and tremor.

items: Intended only for short-term use (generally ≤2–4 weeks)
Elderly patients are at higher risk for falls and confusion
Particularly useful for sleep maintenance insomnia due to intermediate half-life
